newsitem.title: USA: Merrill says offers clients new fee plan.
newsitem.headline: Merrill says offers clients new fee plan.

text.p: Merrill Lynch & Co Inc said on Monday it planned to offer its high net-worth clients a new method of fee-based billing designed to replace the current system of commissions and other fees.

Merrill Lynch said the new fee structure, under which it would simply bill clients a percentage of the assets held in their accounts at the firm, would be available to customers with at least $100,000 in eligible assets at Merrill.

The payments, ranging from 1.5 percent of eligible assets down to below one percent for the largest accounts, cover a pre-set number of annual securities trades and provide an increasing range of products and services as eligible assets increase.

The firm said the four categories of service include: Bronze, for accounts totalling $100,000 to $250,000; Silver, for accounts totalling $250,000 to $500,000; Gold, for accounts totalling $500,000 to $1 million; and Platinum, for accounts totalling in excess of $1 million.
Merrill said it would introduce the plan, called the Merill Lynch Financial Advantage Service, on a pilot basis in 14 markets. Nationwide rollout is due in January, it said.
